intro: Philadelphus satsumi var. kiotensis, commonly known as the Kiotenese Mockorange, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It features fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, simple, and ovate leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is relatively low maintenance and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
